Macmillan Inc., the publishing concern, said it was seeking Federal clearance to join the bidding for Bell & Howell Company. In a Securities and Exchange Commission filing, Macmillan, which holds 7.9 percent of Bell & Howell's shares, said it had filed notice with the Federal Trade Commission and the Justice Department of its intention to buy enough additional shares that ''may result in Macmillan holding more that 50 percent'' of Bell & Howell.

A spokesman for Bell & Howell, the publishing concern based in Skokie. Ill., said that the company had no comment on the announcement. In addition to Macmillan, the British investor Robert Maxwell and Robert M. Bass, the Texas investor, have both expressed interest in Bell & Howell. Last week, the company announced that it was negotiating a management buyout with Mr. Bass and had instructed its financial adviser, Salomon Brothers Inc., to open bidding to other parties.
